If we develop spring applications in Spring Boot, then we don’t need to define single XML configuration and almost no or minimal annotation configuration. Spring Boot Autoconfigurator component will take care of providing these information.
  • If we use @SpringBootApplication annotation at class level, then Spring Boot Autoconfigurator will automatically add all required annotations to Java Class ByteCode.

@SpringBootApplication = @Configuration + @ComponentScan + @EnableAutoConfiguration.
entry.summary: Spring Boot is a framework from “The Spring Team” to ease the bootstrapping and development of new Spring applications. It provides default for code and annotation configuration to quick start new Spring projects within no time.

entry.title: SpringBoot With Swagger
entry.content:
In this post, we will learn about swagger generator to generate Apis and swagger UI in springboot service.

WHAT IS THE SWAGGER?

  • Swagger allows you to describe the structure of your APIs so that machines can read them. The ability of APIs to describe their own structure is the root of all awesomeness in Swagger. Why is it so great? Well, by reading your API’s structure, we can automatically build beautiful and interactive API documentation. We can also automatically generate client libraries for your API in many languages and explore other possibilities like automated testing. Swagger does this by asking your API to return a YAML or JSON that contains a detailed description of your entire API. This file is essentially a resource listing of your API which adheres to OpenAPI Specification.

  • More Information

DEPENDENCIES AND PLUGINS

  • You need to import some dependencies and plugins below into pom.xml of your spring boot project

    <properties>
        ....
		<swagger.version>2.3.1</swagger.version>
		<springfox.version>2.9.2</springfox.version>
        ....
	</properties>

    <!-- swagger -->
    <dependency>
        <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
        <artifactId>swagger-codegen</artifactId>
        <version>${swagger.version}</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>io.springfox</groupId>
        <artifactId>springfox-swagger2</artifactId>
        <version>${springfox.version}</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>io.springfox</groupId>
        <artifactId>springfox-swagger-ui</artifactId>
        <version>${springfox.version}</version>
    </dependency>
    <dependency>
        <groupId>com.fasterxml.jackson.datatype</groupId>
        <artifactId>jackson-datatype-joda</artifactId>
    </dependency>


	<plugins>
    ...
        <plugin>
            <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId>
            <artifactId>build-helper-maven-plugin</artifactId>
            <version>1.9</version>
            <executions>
                <execution>
                    <id>add-source</id>
                    <phase>generate-sources</phase>
                    <goals>
                        <goal>add-source</goal>
                    </goals>
                    <configuration>
                        <sources>
                            <source>${basedir}/target/generated-sources/src/main/java</source>
                        </sources>
                    </configuration>
                </execution>
            </executions>
        </plugin>
        <plugin>
            <groupId>io.swagger</groupId>
            <artifactId>swagger-codegen-maven-plugin</artifactId>
            <version>2.3.1</version>
            <executions>
                <execution>
                    <id>swagger-code-generate</id>
                    <goals>
                        <goal>generate</goal>
                    </goals>
                    <configuration>
                        <!-- path to the swagger file `.yml` -->
                        <inputSpec>${project.basedir}/src/main/resources/swagger/swagger-input.yml
                        </inputSpec>
                        <language>spring</language>
                        <!-- path to the configuration file -->
                        <configurationFile>
                            ${project.basedir}/src/main/resources/swagger/service-config.json
                        </configurationFile>
                        <!-- output directory, place contains generated classes -->
                        <output>${project.build.directory}</output>
                        <!-- path to the resource package that contain configuration templates -->
                        <templateDirectory>src/main/resources/swagger/templates</templateDirectory>
                    </configuration>
                </execution>
            </executions>
        </plugin>
	</plugins>

SWAGGER IMPLEMENTATION AND CONFIGURATION

  • Now let create swagger package in the resources folder and create swagger-input.yml with your api definitions. You can use swagger editor to write your api definitions easily. The example swagger yml will look like below.

    #swagger-input.yml

    swagger: "2.0"
    info:
    title: Todo Application Service
    description: Todo Application Service for note your works
    termsOfService: 'http://swagger.io/terms/'
    contact:
        email: apiteam@swagger.io
    license:
        name: Apache 2.0
        url: 'http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0.html'
    version: 1.0.0
    schemes:
    - "https"
    - "http"
    tags:
    - name: notes
        description: Everything about notes
    - name: welcome
        description: Welcome page
    paths:
    /v1/createUser:
        post:
        tags:
            - users
        summary: create new user for login
        description: create new user for login
        operationId: createUser
        produces:
            - "application/text"
        parameters:
            - in: "query"
            name: "username"
            description: "username"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            - in: "query"
            name: "password"
            description: "password"
            required: true
            type: "string"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                type: string
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    /v1/authenticate:
        post:
        tags:
            - authenticate
        summary: get jwt token
        description: get jwt token
        operationId: getToken
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "body"
            name: "authenticationRequest"
            description: "authenticationRequest"
            required: true
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/JwtTokenRequest'
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/JwtTokenResponse'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    /v1/authenticate/refresh:
        get:
        tags:
            - authenticate
        summary: refresh jwt token
        description: refresh jwt token
        operationId: refreshToken
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "header"
            name: "requestHeader"
            required: true
            description: "header contain jwt token"
            type: "string"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/JwtTokenResponse'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    /v1/welcome:
        get:
        tags:
            - welcome
        summary: return a welcome message
        description: return a welcome message
        operationId: welcome
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Welcome'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    /v1/welcome/{name}:
        get:
        tags:
            - welcome
        summary: return a welcome message
        description: return a welcome message
        operationId: welcomeWithUsername
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "path"
            name: "name"
            description: "name of user"
            required: true
            type: "string"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Welcome'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    /v1/users/{username}/todos:
        post:
        tags:
            - notes
        summary: create a todo
        description: create a todo and save it into database
        operationId: createTodo
        consumes:
            - "application/json"
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "path"
            name: "username"
            description: "name of user"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            - in: "body"
            name: "body"
            description: "body of todo"
            required: true
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Todo'
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Todo'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
        get:
        tags:
            - notes
        summary: get all todos following username
        description: get all todos following username
        operationId: getTodosByUsername
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "path"
            name: "username"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            description: "username"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                type: array
                items:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Todo'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    /v1/users/{username}/todos/{id}:
        get:
        tags:
            - notes
        summary: get a todo
        description: get details of todo
        operationId: getTodoById
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "path"
            name: "username"
            description: "name of user"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            - in: "path"
            name: "id"
            description: "id of todo"
            required: true
            type: "string"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Todo'
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
        put:
        tags:
            - notes
        summary: edit a todo
        description: edit a todo with todoId
        operationId: saveTodoById
        consumes:
            - "application/json"
        produces:
            - "application/json"
        parameters:
            - in: "path"
            name: "username"
            description: "name of user"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            - in: "path"
            name: "id"
            description: "id of todo"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            - in: "body"
            name: "todo"
            description: "body of todo"
            required: true
            schema:
                $ref: '#/definitions/Todo'
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                type: boolean
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
        delete:
        tags:
            - notes
        summary: delete a todo
        description: delete a todo by todoId
        operationId: deleteTodoById
        parameters:
            - in: "path"
            name: "username"
            description: "name of user"
            required: true
            type: "string"
            - in: "path"
            name: "id"
            description: "id of todo"
            required: true
            type: "string"
        responses:
            '200':
            description: OK
            schema:
                type: boolean
            '400':
            description: Invalid input
            '500':
            description: Internal server error
    definitions:
    Auth:
        type: object
        properties:
        message:
            type: string
    Welcome:
        type: object
        properties:
        message:
            type: string
    Todo:
        type: object
        properties:
        id:
            type: string
        username:
            type: string
        description:
            type: string
        targetDate:
            type: string
        isDone:
            type: boolean
    JwtTokenRequest:
        type: object
        properties:
        username:
            type: string
        password:
            type: string
    JwtTokenResponse:
        type: object
        properties:
        token:
            type: string
  • Next, you need to create a file service-config.json with some configuration as below

    #service-config.json

    {
        "artifactId": "todos",
        "basePackage": "com.example.todos",
        "apiPackage": "com.example.todos.api",
        "configPackage": "com.example.todos.api.config",
        "modelPackage": "com.example.todos.api.model",
        "delegatePattern": "true",
        "hideGenerationTimestamp": "true",
        "useBeanValidation": "true",
        "dateLibrary": "joda",
        "sourceFolder": "generated-sources/src/main/java"
    }

TESTING

  • Now, you will use command mvn clean package to build your project with swagger then you will see the generated source as in the image below

  • Now, let create a DelegateImpl component and implement V1ApiDelegate from generated source, then add business code as the example below

    package com.example.todos.delegate;

    import com.example.todos.api.V1ApiDelegate;
    import com.example.todos.api.model.*;
    import com.example.todos.services.AuthenticationService;
    import com.example.todos.services.TodoService;
    import com.example.todos.services.UserService;
    import org.springframework.beans.factory.annotation.Autowired;
    import org.springframework.http.HttpStatus;
    import org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity;
    import org.springframework.stereotype.Component;

    import java.util.List;

    @Component
    public class V1ApiDelegateImpl implements V1ApiDelegate{

        @Autowired
        private TodoService todoService;

        @Autowired
        private UserService userService;

        @Autowired
        private AuthenticationService authenticationService;

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<Todo> createTodo(String username, Todo body) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>(todoService.createTodo(username, body), HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<String> createUser(String username, String password) {
            return ResponseEntity.ok(userService.createUser(username, password));
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<Boolean> deleteTodoById(String username, String id) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>(todoService.deleteTodo(username, id), HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<Todo> getTodoById(String username, String id) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>(todoService.getTodoById(username, id), HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<List<Todo>> getTodosByUsername(String username) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>(todoService.getTodosByUsername(username), HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<JwtTokenResponse> getToken(JwtTokenRequest authenticationRequest) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>(authenticationService.getToken(authenticationRequest), HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<JwtTokenResponse> refreshToken(String requestHeader) {
            JwtTokenResponse token = authenticationService.refreshToken(requestHeader);
            if(token != null) {
                return new ResponseEntity<>(token, HttpStatus.OK);
            }
            throw new RuntimeException("Token can not be refeshed!");
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<Boolean> saveTodoById(String username, String id, Todo todo) {
            return new ResponseEntity<>(todoService.saveTodoById(username, id, todo), HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<Welcome> welcomeWithUsername(String name) {
            Welcome welcome = new Welcome();
            welcome.setMessage("Hi " + name + ", Welcome to my Todo site");
            return new ResponseEntity<>(welcome, HttpStatus.OK);
        }

        @Override
        public ResponseEntity<Welcome> welcome() {
            Welcome welcome = new Welcome();
            welcome.setMessage("Welcome to my Todo site");
            return new ResponseEntity<>(welcome, HttpStatus.OK);
        }
    }
  • Then try to run your project by Swagger2SpringBoot class which stay in your generated-sources folder. Then open browser and go to localhost:8080 to check your swagger-ui.

ADVANCES

  • Sometimes you can not control the generated classes as main class Swagger2SpringBoot or models pojo classes. So, there is a way which will help you to do that. Let’s create a templates package in your resources directory. Then add your configuration mustaches file there. Note the name of mustaches files have to be the same as in this repository.

  • You can copy the content of the mustaches files as in the repo above and edit the content as the way you want.
  • For example, I want to add @JsonIgnoreProperties into every generated models. So I can do it as the image below.

  • Then build your project again and check your generated models, you can see the annotation as below

  • That’s all for this post! Good luck!
